subtitle: Comprehensive module-wise syllabus covering fundamentals, methods, applications and tools

topics.title: Module 1: Introduction to Image Processing
topics.description:
1.1 Fundamentals of Images
- Definition of digital image and image processing
- History and applications of image processing
- Image formation and acquisition
- Types of images: grayscale, color, binary, multispectral, hyperspectral
- Image coordinates and pixel representation
- Digital image properties: resolution, dynamic range, aspect ratio

1.2 Image Representation
- Continuous vs. discrete images
- Sampling and quantization
- Pixel depth (bit depth)
- Image file formats (JPEG, PNG, BMP, TIFF, GIF, etc.)
- Compression techniques (lossy vs. lossless)
- Image storage and memory requirements

1.3 Color Models and Color Space
- RGB (Red-Green-Blue) color model
- CMY/CMYK color model
- HSV (Hue-Saturation-Value) color space
- HSI (Hue-Saturation-Intensity) color space
- YCbCr color space (for compression)
- Color space conversions
- Indexed color vs. true color

1.4 Relationship Between Pixels
- Adjacency (4-connectivity, 8-connectivity, m-connectivity)
- Distance metrics (Euclidean, Manhattan, Chebyshev)
- Connectivity and labeling
- Region and boundary relationships

topics.title: Module 2: Image Enhancement
topics.description:
2.1 Spatial Domain Processing (Direct Pixel Manipulation)
- Point operations (intensity transformations)
- Image negation
- Thresholding (binary thresholding)
- Gray level slicing
- Bit plane slicing
- Intensity level transformations: linear, logarithmic, power-law (gamma), exponential

2.2 Histogram Processing
- Histogram definition and properties
- Histogram equalization
- Adaptive histogram equalization
- Histogram matching/specification
- Histogram stretching and shrinking
- Application to medical and satellite imagery

2.3 Spatial Filtering (Convolution and Correlation)
- Convolution and correlation fundamentals
- Kernel/mask/filter concept
- Border handling (padding, replication, wrapping)
- Smoothing filters: averaging/box filter, weighted averaging, median, bilateral, Gaussian
- Sharpening filters: Laplacian, unsharp masking, high-pass, high-boost, Sobel
- Combination filters, band-pass and notch filtering

2.4 Frequency Domain Processing
- Fourier transform fundamentals (1D, 2D, DFT, FFT)
- Properties of Fourier transform
- Frequency domain filtering: low-pass, high-pass, band-pass, notch (Butterworth, Gaussian, ideal)
- Other transforms: DCT, Wavelet, Radon

2.5 Image Restoration
- Noise models and types (Gaussian, salt-and-pepper, Poisson, uniform, periodic)
- Noise reduction techniques: mean, median, morphological opening/closing, Wiener, Kalman
- Deblurring: inverse filtering, Wiener for blur, constrained least-squares, motion blur removal

topics.title: Module 3: Image Segmentation
topics.description:
3.1 Thresholding
- Global, local/adaptive, Otsu's method, multi-level, hysteresis thresholding

3.2 Edge Detection
- Operators: Sobel, Prewitt, Roberts, Laplacian, LoG, Canny
- Edge linking and boundary tracing, connected component analysis
- Hough transform for line and circle detection
- Active contours (snakes)

3.3 Corner Detection
- Harris corner detector, FAST, SIFT keypoint detection, ORB

3.4 Region-Based Segmentation
- Region growing, seed selection, similarity criteria
- Region splitting and merging, quadtree decomposition
- Clustering: K-means, Fuzzy C-means, Watershed
- Graph-based methods: min-cut, normalized cut, spectral clustering, MRF

3.5 Morphological Segmentation
- Binary and gray-scale morphology: erosion, dilation, opening, closing, morphological gradient, top-hat, reconstruction

3.6 Active Contours and Deformable Models
- Parametric snakes, geodesic active contours, level set methods

topics.title: Module 4: Feature Extraction and Representation
topics.description:
4.1 Texture Analysis
- Texture features: statistical (mean, variance, skewness, kurtosis), autocorrelation, GLCM, LBP, GLRLM
- Texture descriptors: Tamura, Gabor responses, wavelet features, fractal dimension

4.2 Shape Analysis
- Boundary-based descriptors (chain code, Fourier descriptors), region-based (moments, Hu moments)
- Skeleton/medial axis, shape context, compactness, circularity
- Shape matching and Procrustes analysis

4.3 Interest Point Detection
- SIFT, SURF, BRIEF, ORB and descriptor matching

4.4 Object Recognition and Classification
- Template matching, feature-based recognition, cascaded classifiers, Bag-of-Words, CNNs

topics.title: Module 5: Image Restoration and Reconstruction
topics.description:
5.1 Image Restoration Models
- Degradation and noise model assumptions, restoration vs. enhancement, inverse problems

5.2 Restoration Techniques
- Spatial and frequency domain methods, iterative restoration (Richardson-Lucy), regularization

5.3 Super-Resolution
- Multi-frame and single-image super-resolution, interpolation (bilinear, bicubic), deep learning-based methods

5.4 Image Inpainting
- Content-aware, exemplar-based, PDE-based, deep learning approaches

5.5 Image Reconstruction
- Tomographic reconstruction (CT, MRI), Radon transform and inverse, filtered back-projection, iterative reconstruction

topics.title: Module 6: Image Compression
topics.description:
6.1 Compression Fundamentals
- Lossless vs. lossy, entropy concepts, compression ratio, PSNR, SSIM, rate-distortion theory

6.2 Lossless Compression
- RLE, Huffman, arithmetic coding, Lempel-Ziv families, PNG and TIFF specifics

6.3 Lossy Compression
- Transform-based compression (DCT/JPEG), wavelet-based (JPEG2000), quantization, JPEG encoding, Huffman in JPEG

6.4 Video Compression
- Inter-frame/intra-frame coding, motion compensation, MPEG, H.264/AVC

6.5 Image Quality Assessment
- Objective metrics (PSNR, SSIM, RMSE), subjective assessment, perceptual metrics

topics.title: Module 7: Image Matching and Registration
topics.description:
7.1 Image Registration
- Feature-based and intensity-based registration, transformation models (rigid, affine, projective, deformable)
- Algorithms: least-squares, mutual information, optical flow, phase correlation, ICP

7.2 Image Matching
- Feature and descriptor matching (SIFT, SURF, ORB), distance metrics, RANSAC, feature tracking

7.3 Geometric Transformations
- Affine and perspective transformations, warping, morphing, perspective correction

topics.title: Module 8: Image Analysis and Understanding
topics.description:
8.1 Object Detection
- Cascade classifiers, sliding window, multi-scale, region proposals (R-CNN family), YOLO, SSD

8.2 Object Tracking
- Centroid tracking, Kalman filtering, mean-shift, Camshift, deep learning trackers

8.3 Scene Understanding
- Scene classification, context modeling, semantic understanding, 3D reconstruction

8.4 Action and Event Recognition
- Temporal modeling, motion detection, action recognition, event detection in videos

topics.title: Module 9: 3D Image Processing
topics.description:
9.1 3D Imaging Fundamentals
- 3D image formation, volumetric and surface representations, point clouds, depth/disparity maps

9.2 3D Reconstruction
- Stereo vision, epipolar geometry, stereo matching, structure from motion, photogrammetry, shape from shading/texture

9.3 3D Segmentation
- Volumetric and point-cloud segmentation, surface segmentation

9.4 3D Visualization
- Volume rendering, surface rendering, isosurfaces, VR visualization

topics.title: Module 10: Specialized Image Processing Applications
topics.description:
10.1 Medical Image Processing
- Modalities (X-ray, CT, MRI, ultrasound, PET), organ/tissue segmentation, registration, image-guided surgery

10.2 Remote Sensing Image Processing
- Satellite imagery, multispectral/hyperspectral analysis, land cover classification, change detection

10.3 Video Processing
- Motion estimation, optical flow, video segmentation, stabilization, frame interpolation

10.4 Face Recognition
- Detection, alignment, feature extraction, verification/identification, emotion recognition

10.5 Document Image Processing
- Binarization, skew correction, layout analysis, OCR, handwriting recognition

10.6 Biometric Image Processing
- Fingerprint, iris, palmprint, gait recognition

topics.title: Module 11: Deep Learning for Image Processing
topics.description:
11.1 Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
- Architecture, convolution/pooling/FC layers, activations, backpropagation, popular architectures (LeNet, AlexNet, VGG, ResNet, DenseNet, MobileNet)

11.2 Object Detection with Deep Learning
- R-CNN family, YOLO, SSD, region proposals, bounding box regression

11.3 Semantic and Instance Segmentation
- FCN, U-Net, DeepLab, SegNet, Mask R-CNN

11.4 Generative Models
- Autoencoders, GANs, image-to-image translation, super-resolution GANs, style transfer

11.5 Transfer Learning
- Pre-trained models, fine-tuning, domain adaptation, data augmentation

topics.title: Module 12: Image Processing Tools and Software
topics.description:
12.1 Programming Libraries
- Python libraries: OpenCV, Pillow, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-image, Matplotlib, TensorFlow, PyTorch
- MATLAB: Image Processing and Computer Vision Toolboxes
- Other tools: ImageMagick, GIMP, ITK

12.2 Software Platforms
- Deep learning frameworks, scientific environments, commercial software (Photoshop), medical imaging software (DICOM viewers, Slicer)

topics.title: Module 13: Performance Evaluation and Benchmarking
topics.description:
13.1 Evaluation Metrics
- Accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, confusion matrix, ROC/AUC, mAP, IoU

13.2 Benchmarking
- Standard datasets (ImageNet, COCO, Pascal VOC, CIFAR), medical datasets, computational complexity analysis

13.3 Visualization and Interpretation
- Feature visualization, activation maps, gradient-based methods, explainability

topics.title: Module 14: Emerging Topics and Future Directions
topics.description:
14.1 Advanced Topics
- Computational photography, image forensics, privacy-preserving processing, adversarial robustness, federated learning

14.2 Multimodal Image Processing
- Image+text, cross-modal retrieval, vision-language models

14.3 Real-Time Processing
- GPU acceleration, edge computing, mobile image processing, lightweight models

14.4 Quantum Image Processing
- Quantum image representation, quantum transforms, potential quantum advantages
